column4: Oh Amigos, I installed Hardy Heron 'inside' Window. It asked me a username, I chose one. I chose a password for it too. But what's the root password?
there is no root password, use sudo instead.
They will be preserved.  When the upgrade does its upgrade, it'll ask you if there are config file conflicts (and then ask what you want to do, edit, save backup, etc)
However, backingup /etc is never a bad thing.
